error.message: Call to deprecated function db_table_exists(). Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Instead, get a database connection injected into your service from the container, get its schema driver, and call tableExists() on it. For example,
Call to deprecated function drupal_set_message(). Deprecated in drupal:8.5.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\Messenger\MessengerInterface::addMessage() instead.
Call to deprecated function drupal_set_message(). Deprecated in drupal:8.5.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\Messenger\MessengerInterface::addMessage() instead.
Call to deprecated function drupal_set_message(). Deprecated in drupal:8.5.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\Messenger\MessengerInterface::addMessage() instead.

Call to deprecated method getUsername() of class Drupal\user\Entity\User. Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal\Core\Session\AccountInterface::getAccountName() or \Drupal\user\UserInterface::getDisplayName() instead.
Call to deprecated method url() of class Drupal. Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Instead create a \Drupal\Core\Url object directly, for example using Url::fromRoute().
Call to deprecated method url() of class Drupal. Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Instead create a \Drupal\Core\Url object directly, for example using Url::fromRoute().
Add core_version_requirement: ^8 || ^9 to flood_bypass.info.yml to designate that the module is compatible with Drupal 9. See https://www.drupal.org/node/3070687.
A drupal/core requirement is not present in composer.json. Having a composer.json is not a requirement for Drupal 9 compatibility but if there is one, it should include a drupal/core requirement.
